title: What Does "Eepy" Mean & Why Are People Saying It So Much?

steps.title: Eepy is a shortened, baby-talk version of the word â€œsleepy.â€
steps.content: Eepy is a shortened, baby-talk version of the word â€œsleepy.â€ â€œEepyâ€ leaves the â€œSâ€ and â€œLâ€ off of the word â€œsleepy,â€ creating a cute internet slang term used all across social media. [1] X Research source Itâ€™s primarily used to describe sleepy-looking animals and babies, but some may use it to talk about themselves or their tired partners. For example, this TikTok by @montythecuddledog shows clips of an adorable blue heeler with the caption â€œso eepy.â€ This Instagram post by @rartcattos shows an image of a tiny orange kitten with the text â€œso eepyâ€ over it. TikToker @georgialynnrose made a video of her girlfriend walking down the stairs with the text â€œpov: my gf takes a 3 hour nap while iâ€™m at her house.â€ The caption says â€œsheâ€™s eepy.â€

steps.title: â€Eepyâ€ comes from a misspelled Twitter (X) post of a sleepy kitten.
steps.content: â€Eepyâ€ comes from a misspelled Twitter (X) post of a sleepy kitten. On November 21, 2021, user @AnimalsCaption posted a GIF of a kitten falling asleep on the edge of a mug of coffee, captioned with â€œand why he eepy ğŸ˜‚.â€ The GIF went viral, inspiring other users on Twitter and other platforms to post photos and drawings of other â€œeepyâ€ animals. [2] X Research source For example, on March 2, 2022, Instagram user @matthew.niverse posted a new video over the original GIF of a different cat falling asleep on a bed. In September 2022, Instagram account @monkey.posting posted a screencap of the GIF with an image of a sleeping chimp pasted over it. A TikTok sound made by user @jorblorn that says â€œThe missile is very tired. He is eepy.â€ helped spread the term over the platform. Other users began using the term â€œeepyâ€ out of context, creating a new slang term for any cute and sleepy animal (or person).

steps.title: The â€œWhy he eepy?â€ meme is a reference to â€œWhy he ourple?â€
steps.content: The â€œWhy he eepy?â€ meme is a reference to â€œWhy he ourple?â€ The â€œWhy he ourple?â€ meme came from a comment on a TikTok of a cat with inexplicably purple spots. [3] X Research source The exact comment says â€œAnd why he ourple? ğŸ˜‚â€ and is believed to have influenced Twitter user @AnimalsCaption to caption their own GIF with â€œAnd why he eepy? ğŸ˜‚â€ [4] X Research source After the original comment was posted, it was later screenshotted and posted by Twitter user @bicfruntes, where it quickly spread. In January 2022, iFunny user Hey_Kaminari posted a screenshot from the game Five Nights at Freddyâ€™s of the purple protagonist Micheal Afton walking by while another character says â€œand why he ourple? ğŸ˜‚â€

steps.title: Describe cute animals as â€œeepyâ€ if they look exhausted.
steps.content: Describe cute animals as â€œeepyâ€ if they look exhausted. You might post an adorable pic of a sleeping kitten and paste the word â€œeepyâ€ over it, or call a cute dog eepy in person. If you see a post of a sleeping animal, you can comment that they look â€œeepyâ€ or caption it with something like â€œwhen you have an essay due at midnight but youâ€™re so very eepy.â€ [5] X Research source Aww, he looks so eepy today! That kitten is desperately trying to beat the eepy allegations. Why is my puppy so eepy? I feel like he sleeps all day.

steps.title: Call your partner â€œeepyâ€ if theyâ€™re super adorably sleepy.
steps.content: Call your partner â€œeepyâ€ if theyâ€™re super adorably sleepy. You might text and ask them if theyâ€™re feeling â€œeepyâ€ or say they look â€œeepyâ€ when they come home. If theyâ€™re comfortable with it, you might also post a fun skit or video online where you affectionately describe them as â€œeepy.â€ Iâ€™m so eepy today, I really donâ€™t want to go to work. My boyfriend is so eepy. He worked all weekend!

steps.title: Skrunkly
steps.content: Skrunkly â€œSkrunklyâ€ is a term of endearment for an animal, character, or celebrity who looks cute in an eccentric, weird, or funky way. [6] X Research source Although itâ€™s not certain where this term came from, some believe that it was coined in a meme by Instagram user @mr.__vulpes in May 2021. [7] X Research source I love possums, theyâ€™re so skrunkly! Look at this raccoon, heâ€™s so skrunkly! I love him so much.

steps.title: Velcro cat
steps.content: Velcro cat â€œVelcro catâ€ is used to describe a kitty who is always by your side, no matter what. They might constantly follow you, cuddle with you, or seek your attention when youâ€™re focused on something else. [8] X Research source Meet my velcro cat, he likes to ride on my shoulders at all times. I definitely have a velcro cat, she even follows me into the bathroom!

steps.title: Doggo
steps.content: Doggo â€œDoggoâ€ is a cutesy way of talking about a dog. No oneâ€™s sure when this word was coined, but it probably became popular in 2014 through a Facebook group called â€œDogspotting.â€ The Twitter account @dog_rates also spread this adorable term. Although itâ€™s less popular nowadays, some internet users still comment â€œdoggo!â€ on cute pictures of pups. [9] X Research source Look at this doggo! I love him so much. I have 4 adorable doggos. Theyâ€™re all German shepherds!
